action.action-desc: Mr. Massie introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To reduce, from 21 years of age to 18 years of age, the minimum age at which a person may obtain a handgun from a Federal firearms licensee.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Second Amendment For Every Registrable Voter Act or the SAFER Voter Act.

section.header: Minimum age for obtaining a handgun from a federal firearms licensee

subsection.text: Section 922(b)(1) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking , and, if the firearm, or ammunition is other than a shotgun or rifle, or ammunition for a shotgun or rifle, to any individual who the licensee knows or has reasonable cause to believe is less than twenty-one years of age.

Section 922(c)(1) of such title is amended by striking , in the case of any firearm other than a shotgun or a rifle, I am twenty-one years or more of age, or that, in the case of a shotgun or a rifle,.
